009package imagingbook.common.filter.examples;
010
011import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterScalar;
013import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.LinearFilter;
014import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.LinearFilterSeparable;
015import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
016import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
017
018/**
019 * <p>
020 * Example filter based on {@link GenericFilterScalar} performing
021 * linear convolution with a custom 3x3 filter kernel.
022 * This filter may be applied to any image. 
023 * On vector-valued images (e.g., RGB images) the filter is applied
024 * independently to each component.
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * Usage:
028 * </p>
029 * <pre>
030 * ImageProcessor ip = ...      // any image
031 * GenericFilter filter = new ExampleFilter3x3Scalar();
032 * filter.applyTo(ip);          // modifies ip
033 * </pre>
034 * <p>
035 * Note: This is merely a linear filter with a custom kernel to demonstrate
036 * the concept of a generic filter.
037 * In practice (depending on the type of kernel) this would be implemented
038 * as a sub-class of {@link LinearFilter} or {@link LinearFilterSeparable},
039 * which is much more efficient.
040 * </p>
041 * 
042 * @author WB
043 * @see LinearFilter
044 * @see LinearFilterSeparable
045 * @see GenericFilter#applyTo(ij.process.ImageProcessor)
046 * @see GenericFilter#applyTo(ij.process.ImageProcessor, imagingbook.common.image.access.OutOfBoundsStrategy)
047 */
048public class ExampleFilter3x3Scalar extends GenericFilterScalar {
049        
050        // custom (nonsymmetric) convolution kernel
051        private final static float[][] H = {
052                        {0, 1, 2},
053                        {7, 8, 3},
054                        {6, 5, 4}};
055        
056        private final static int width = H[0].length;                   // = 3
057        private final static int height = H.length;                             // = 3
058        private final static int xc = width / 2;                                // = 1
059        private final static int yc = height / 2;                               // = 1
060        private final static float s = (float) Matrix.sum(H);
061        
062        @Override
063        protected float doPixel(PixelSlice slice, int u, int v) {       // return scalar value
064                float sum = 0;
065                for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
066                        int vj = v + j - yc;
067                        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
068                                int ui = u + i - xc;
069                                float p = slice.getVal(ui, vj);         // read scalar pixel value
070                                sum = sum + p * H[i][j];
071                        }
072                }
073                return sum / s;
074        }
075
076}
